body:
**What happened**:
pod can't be removed from scheduler cache when be deleted,  logs in kube-scheduler is below:

I1128 16:41:50.819639   31593 leaderelection.go:344] lock is held by shaphicpra14907_64ccb0c5-aaa1-435d-a4b4-ead4bb3de63b and has not yet expired
I1128 16:41:50.819678   31593 leaderelection.go:240] failed to acquire lease kube-system/kube-scheduler
I1128 16:41:53.740234   31593 leaderelection.go:344] lock is held by shaphicpra14907_64ccb0c5-aaa1-435d-a4b4-ead4bb3de63b and has not yet expired
I1128 16:41:53.740365   31593 leaderelection.go:240] failed to acquire lease kube-system/kube-scheduler
I1128 16:41:57.734692   31593 leaderelection.go:245] successfully acquired lease kube-system/kube-scheduler
I1128 16:41:57.834958   31593 shared_informer.go:176] caches populated
E1128 16:42:11.731020   31593 eventhandlers.go:226] scheduler cache UpdatePod failed: pod 3c6696c6-decb-4abd-a1d3-d891e032459d is not added to scheduler cache, so cannot be updated
E1128 16:42:12.339189   31593 eventhandlers.go:226] scheduler cache UpdatePod failed: pod 3c6696c6-decb-4abd-a1d3-d891e032459d is not added to scheduler cache, so cannot be updated
E1128 16:42:12.345323   31593 eventhandlers.go:226] scheduler cache UpdatePod failed: pod 3c6696c6-decb-4abd-a1d3-d891e032459d is not added to scheduler cache, so cannot be updated
E1128 16:42:20.628894   31593 eventhandlers.go:226] scheduler cache UpdatePod failed: pod 3c6696c6-decb-4abd-a1d3-d891e032459d is not added to scheduler cache, so cannot be updated
E1128 16:42:20.632578   31593 eventhandlers.go:254] scheduler cache RemovePod failed: pod 3c6696c6-decb-4abd-a1d3-d891e032459d is not found in scheduler cache, so cannot be removed from it


**What you expected to happen**:

pod in scheduler cache can be deleted successfully when pod is deleted

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:

main steps to reproduce this bug is these:
1. two scheduler run in leader-elect=true mode，schedulerA is the leader scheduler, and schedulerB is an assistant.
2. create pod1 with "namespace1/name1" and it runs on Node1
3. break down the network between schedulerB and kube-apiserver
4. delete pod1 and create pod2 with same name, ie "namespace1/name1" and pod2 been assigned to Node1 by schedulerA again.
5. turn off schedulerA and recover the network between schedulerB and kube-apiserver, and then schedulerB become the leader scheduler.
6. delete pod2. this time log in schedulerB will print this: 

E1128 16:42:11.731020   31593 eventhandlers.go:226] scheduler cache UpdatePod failed: pod 3c6696c6-decb-4abd-a1d3-d891e032459d is not added to scheduler cache, so cannot be updated
E1128 16:42:20.632578   31593 eventhandlers.go:254] scheduler cache RemovePod failed: pod 3c6696c6-decb-4abd-a1d3-d891e032459d is not found in scheduler cache, so cannot be removed from it

7. At this time, if I create a new pod3 with podAntiAffinity to pod1. the result is pod3 can't been assigned to Node1 because pod1 is still in schedulerB's scheduler cache.

**Anything else we need to know?**:

the reason of this bug is below:

since PR(https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/61069), podKey in scheduler cache use pod's UID instead of namespace/name
however, the key in SharedIndexInformer still use namespace/name
in this upper case, delete the pod and create a same name pod may be delivered as one update notification.( see disscusion： https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/83810)
scheduler received pod update notification and then print below log.

E1128 16:42:11.731020   31593 eventhandlers.go:226] scheduler cache UpdatePod failed: pod 3c6696c6-decb-4abd-a1d3-d891e032459d is not added to scheduler cache, so cannot be updated
 

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):

Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"15", GitVersion:"v1.15.0", GitCommit:"e8462b5b5dc2584fdcd18e6bcfe9f1e4d970a529", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-06-19T16:40:16Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.5", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}

Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"15", GitVersion:"v1.15.0", GitCommit:"e8462b5b5dc2584fdcd18e6bcfe9f1e4d970a529", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-06-19T16:40:16Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.5", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration:
- OS (e.g: `cat /etc/os-release`):
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):
- Install tools:
- Network plugin and version (if this is a network-related bug):
- Others:

title: Deleted pods may remain in scheduler cache and cause scheduling exception
